title: [又多2個] 已經有33位、3分之1嘅參議員聯署咗民主法案

replies.msg:

《人權法》嘅聯署人數再多兩位，總數係33位，換言之已經有三分之一嘅參議員聯署咗

Source：https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/senate-bill/1838/cosponsors

【支持學界外交工作．眾籌進行中】

可能無眾志咁出名，但學界外交團隊都幫左好多手，仲有八日希望大家一人捐d

23/10(Wed)： 7點重慶大廈合唱團，7點半英領國旗人鏈
24/10(Thu)： 9點18區連儂日
25/10(Fri)： 朝早8點九龍港島和你返工
26/10(Sat)： 12點18區Suck-神獸[長龍]，6點遮打醫療專職集會
27/10(Sun)： 3點尖沙咀守護清真寺，4點觀塘自由紙鶴追悼會

replies.msg:
H.R.3289
Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act of 2019 Senate Calendar - Order # 238
Senate needs "unanimous consent "' all 100 senators to vote YES to move the bill to the front for expedite proceedings!!!!!!
[/b][/b]
CCP/Lam/BlueC/businessmen target:
Sink the bill to the bottom of the list ! Avoid at all cost to bring to the front. They only need to use all lobby effort , including possible exchange of benefits ( CCP style!!!), to convince at least one senator to vote NO to meet NO unanimous consent.

Beside the scene is intense lobbying effort from all power and stakeholders for long period of time!!!

HR3289 : list of cosponsors for the bill http://tiny.cc/rf70ez
Please send a note of thanks to ALL 47 of them !!

Senators complete list and contact info.:
https://www.senate.gov/general/contact_information/senators_cfm.cfm

Would you like to convince each of the 100 senators how much we need them NOW to vote YES NOW?

Some of them 1) do not like violence 2) are under heavy lobbying from businessmen and CCP to protect their interests !!

All opposing power will submit evidence of violence and blame everything on protestors with list of photos/video evidence.

CCP/ Lam have been doing lots of lobbying in Senate targeting at specific ones who may have or whose family may have ties to business in china. ( not FC)

Senate have many more influence from businessmen than that on House of Representative, the one that passed the Bill a few days ago

____________________________________________________
unanimous consent - A senator may request unanimous consent on the floor to set aside a specified rule of procedure so as to expedite proceedings. If no Senator objects, the Senate permits the action, but if any one senator objects, the request is rejected. Most measures are placed on the calendar under the heading "General Orders" in the sequence in which they were added.

unanimous consent - A senator may request unanimous consent on the floor to set aside a specified rule of procedure so as to expedite proceedings.
